org.fujion.common

Class StrUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fujion.common.StrUtil

  • public class StrUtil
extends Object
    Utility methods for managing strings.

    • Method Detail

      • split

        public static String[] split(String text,
                             String delimiter)
        Splits a string using the specified delimiter.
        Parameters:
        text - The string to split.
        delimiter - The delimiter for the split operation.
        Returns:
        A string array containing the split values. The returned array is guaranteed not to contain null values by replacing every occurrence of a null value with an empty string.

      • split

        public static String[] split(String text,
                             String delimiter,
                             int count)
        Splits a string using the specified delimiter.
        Parameters:
        text - The string to split.
        delimiter - The delimiter for the split operation.
        count - Specifies a minimum number of elements to be returned. If the result of the split operation results in fewer elements, the returned array is expanded to contain the minimum number of elements.
        Returns:
        A string array containing the split values. The returned array is guaranteed not to contain null values by replacing every occurrence of a null value with an empty string.

      • split

        public static String[] split(String text,
                             String delimiter,
                             int count,
                             boolean nonull)
        Splits a string using the specified delimiter.
        Parameters:
        text - The string to split.
        delimiter - The delimiter for the split operation.
        count - Specifies a minimum number of elements to be returned. If the result of the split operation results in fewer elements, the returned array is expanded to contain the minimum number of elements.
        nonull - If true, the returned array is guaranteed not to contain null values by replacing every occurrence of a null value with an empty string.
        Returns:
        A string array containing the split values.

      • strTruncate

        public static String strTruncate(String value,
                                 int maxLength)
        Truncates a string if it exceeds a maximum length, appending an ellipsis to the end.
        Parameters:
        value - String value to modify.
        maxLength - Maximum length for string.
        Returns:
        Original string if less than or equal to the maximum length. Otherwise, a truncated string with an ellipsis appended.

        Append a value to a string builder, using specified separator.
        Parameters:
        sb - StringBuilder instance to append to.
        value - Value to append.
        Returns:
        The StringBuilder instance (for chaining).

        separator - String to use as separator.
        Returns:
        The StringBuilder instance (for chaining).

        value - Value to append.

                           String delimiter)

      • piece

        public static String piece(String text,
                           String delimiter,
                           int position)
        Returns the specified piece of text as delimited by delimiter.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to piece.
        delimiter - Delimiter for piecing.
        position - Position of piece to extract.
        Returns:
        The requested text piece.

      • piece

        public static String piece(String text,
                           String delimiter,
                           int start,
                           int end)
        Performs the equivalent of the MUMPS piece function.
        Parameters:
        text - Text to piece.
        delimiter - Delimiter for piecing.
        start - First piece to return.
        end - Last piece to return.
        Returns:
        The requested text pieces.

      • extractInt

        public static int extractInt(String value)
        Extracts an integer portion at the beginning of a string. Parsing stops when a non-digit character or the end of the string is encountered.
        Parameters:
        value - String value to parse
        Returns:
        The integer value at the beginning of the string.

      • extractIntPrefix

        public static String extractIntPrefix(String value)
        Extracts an integer portion at the beginning of a string. Parsing stops when a non-digit character or the end of the string is encountered.
        Parameters:
        value - String value to parse
        Returns:
        The integer prefix (as a string) of the parsed string.

        Parameters:
        value - Input value.
        Returns:
        Input value without the enclosing quotes.

      • toBoolean

        public static boolean toBoolean(String text)
        Converts a text value to a boolean result.
        Parameters:
        text - Value to convert. Non-zero numeric values or values beginning with a T, t, Y, or y evaluate to true.
        Returns:
        The result of the conversion.

      • toList

        public static List<String> toList(String text)
        Converts a string containing a '\n'-delimited list of elements to a string list.
        Parameters:
        text - The string containing the '\n'-delimited elements.
        Returns:
        A list containing the parsed elements.

      • toList

        public static List<String> toList(String text,
                                  String delimiter)
        Converts a string containing a delimited list of elements to a string list.
        Parameters:
        text - The string containing the delimited elements.
        delimiter - The delimiter that separates the elements in the input string.
        Returns:
        A list containing the parsed elements.

      • toList

        public static List<String> toList(String text,
                                  List<String> list)
        Converts a string containing a '\n'-delimited list of elements to a string list.
        Parameters:
        text - The string containing the '\n'-delimited elements.
        list - The string list that will receive the parsed elements. If null, a new list is created. If not null, the list is cleared before adding elements.
        Returns:
        A list containing the parsed elements. If the input list was not null, that instance is returned. Otherwise, a newly created list is returned.

      • toList

        public static List<String> toList(String text,
                                  List<String> list,
                                  String delimiter)
        Converts a string containing a delimited list of elements to a string list.
        Parameters:
        text - The string containing the delimited elements.
        list - The string list that will receive the parsed elements. If null, a new list is created. If not null, the list is cleared before adding elements.
        delimiter - The delimiter that separates the elements in the input string.
        Returns:
        A list containing the parsed elements. If the input list was not null, that instance is returned. Otherwise, a newly created list is returned.

      • fromList

        public static String fromList(Iterable<?> list)
        Builds a newline-delimited string from a list.
        Parameters:
        list - The list of strings to concatenate.
        Returns:
        A string contains the list of elements separated by the newline character.

      • fromList

        public static String fromList(Iterable<?> list,
                              String delimiter)
        Builds a delimited string from a list.
        Parameters:
        list - The list of strings to concatenate.
        delimiter - The delimiter to use to separate elements.
        Returns:
        A string contains the list of elements separated by the specified delimiter.

      • fromList

        public static String fromList(Iterable<?> list,
                              String delimiter,
                              String dflt)
        Builds a delimited string from a list.
        Parameters:
        list - The list of strings to concatenate.
        delimiter - The delimiter to use to separate elements.
        dflt - The default value to use if a list entry is null.
        Returns:
        A string contains the list of elements separated by the specified delimiter.

      • xlate

        public static String xlate(String text,
                           String from,
                           String to)
        Replaces one set of characters with another. Each character in the from parameter is replaced by the character in the corresponding position in the to parameter. If no corresponding character is present, the character is removed instead.
        Parameters:
        text - The string to modify.
        from - The list of characters to be replaced.
        to - The list of replacement characters.
        Returns:
        The modified input string.

      • formatMessage

        public static String formatMessage(String msg,
                                   Locale locale,
                                   Object... args)
        Formats a message. If the message begins with "@", the remainder is assumed to be a label name that is resolved.
        Parameters:
        msg - Message to format or, if starts with "@", a label reference.
        locale - Optional locale
        args - Optional replaceable parameters.
        Returns:
        The formatted message.

      • formatMessage

        public static String formatMessage(String msg,
                                   Object... args)
        Formats a message. If the message begins with "@", the remainder is assumed to be a label identifier that is resolved.
        Parameters:
        msg - Message to format or, if starts with "@", a label reference.
        args - Optional replaceable parameters.
        Returns:
        The formatted message.

      • getLabel

        public static String getLabel(String id,
                              Object... args)
        Returns a formatted message given a label identifier.
        Parameters:
        id - A label identifier.
        args - Optional replaceable parameters.
        Returns:
        The formatted label.

      • getLabel

        public static String getLabel(String id,
                              Locale locale,
                              Object... args)
        Returns a formatted message given a label identifier. Recognizes line continuation with backslash characters.
        Parameters:
        id - A label identifier.
        locale - The locale.
        args - Optional replaceable parameters.
        Returns:
        The formatted label.
